dialogue_history.content:
Analyze this financial news and estimate stock price movement probabilities.
Company: Apple Inc. (AAPL)
News Headline: Why you should buy the 493 other S&P 500 stocks — and not the Mag 7
News Content: Listen and subscribe to Opening Bid on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, YouTube or wherever you find your favorite podcasts.

Time for investors to have a wider stock screener.

The so-called “Magnificent Seven” inside the S&P 500 have crowded out headlines and investor thought schools for the past year amid explosive hype around AI and profit growth. But with new narratives forming in the market — such as higher bond yields and inflated tech expectations — it may be time to sniff around the S&P's 493 other stocks.

Those 493 stocks could post a very solid 11% earnings growth this year (faster than the 8% growth in 2024) and valuations may not yet reflect that, Gargi Chaudhuri, BlackRock's chief investment strategist for the Americas, told Yahoo Finance Executive Editor Brian Sozzi on his Opening Bid podcast (video above; listen below).

Mag 7 names are expected to grow earnings by 18% in 2025, a slowdown from its 25% pace in 2024 — a change many upbeat investors may not be anticipating.

Chaudhuri said there are good investing opportunities this year in financials.

"Broadly the theme that we're talking about in our year ahead outlook is one of quality. It is the intersection we call of quality and growth, with an eye on valuations because obviously valuations are very important to investors," Chaudhuri explained.

Chaudhuri may be ahead of the curve on her call as earnings season unfold.

FactSet estimates that seven sectors from inside the S&P 500 should report fourth quarter earnings growth, and six should have growth in the double-digits. The financials sector is slated to chime in with the highest profit increase in the quarter at 39.5%.

“If you look at earnings growth expectations, not just for Q4, but in Q1 for financials is where we’re expecting to see some of the strongest earnings growth come through after tech and comp services,” notes Chaudhuri.

FactSet says that double-digit profit growth should also hit information technology, consumer discretionary, healthcare, utilities, and communications services names.

See more from the Opening Bid podcast

Why you should buy the 493 other S&P 500 stocks — and not the Mag 7 Nvidia stock sell-off: Time to back up the truck? Yahoo co-founder Jerry Yang: Masayoshi Son is recasting himself into an AI player with his $100 billion bet

In addition to seeking quality and growth, “we’re talking about this concept of growth at a reasonable price,” said Chaudhuri. “We look at strong, healthy balance sheets, low leverage, and companies that are really able to have repetitive earnings growth.”

In some respects, buying the S&P 500's 493 other stocks at reasonable valuations may be a sort of defensive trade in the current environment.

The latest jobs report sent stocks on a downward spiral. Headlines abounded detailing how the Dow Jones Industrial Average lost nearly 700 points as wary investors react to potentially fewer Fed rate cuts.

Story Continues

Meanwhile, 10-year bond yields creeping toward 5% have rattled investors in the Mag 7 names —a trade that usually works best when yields are below 4%.

Read more: why the bull stampede in stocks may just be starting

Year to date, Mag 7 name Nvidia (NVDA) is down 4%, Amazon (AMZN) is off by 2%, Apple (AAPL) is down 8%, Microsoft (MSFT) is down 2% and Alphabet (GOOGL) has dropped 1%. The lone outperformers are Meta (META) and Tesla (TSLA), likely on fresh efforts by CEOs Mark Zuckerberg and Elon Musk to curry favor with the incoming Trump administration.

“We are beginning to see that there can be micro narratives that take hold of the market,” said Chaudhuri. “They’re going to be more prevalent in 2025. One of the ways we think investors can actually take advantage of that is being a little bit more dynamic in their portfolios.”

Three times each week, Yahoo Finance Executive Editor Brian Sozzi fields insight-filled conversations and chats with the biggest names in business and markets on Opening Bid. You can find more episodes on our video hub or watch on your preferred streaming service.

Grace Williams is a writer for Yahoo Finance.

Click here for in-depth analysis of the latest stock market news and events moving stock prices

Read the latest financial and business news from Yahoo Finance

View Comments

Next I will provide you some predictions of stock price movement probabilities and the corresponding analysis by others in the previous rounds.
Note that others' predictions may indicate that they have some other information about the stock price. A high prediction may indicate that they have some positive information about the stock, while a low prediction may indicate that they have some megative information about the stock.
Also note that there are multiple rounds of precitions, demonstrating the trend of others' beliefs.
Please take these information into consideration when prediction the stock price movement probabilities.
Previous predictions:
Round: 0
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.35, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.65, Reasoning: The news discusses a potential shift in investor focus away from the 'Magnificent Seven' stocks, including Apple, suggesting that these stocks may not perform as well due to slowing earnings growth and rising bond yields. Apple has already seen a decline in its stock price year-to-date, and the broader market sentiment seems cautious due to macroeconomic factors such as interest rates and economic outlook. Thus, there is a higher probability of Apple’s stock price falling compared to rising in the current environment.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.45, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.55, Reasoning: The news article suggests a potential shift in market focus away from the 'Magnificent Seven' stocks, including Apple, towards other opportunities within the S&P 500. Key points include: 1) Apple's stock is already down year-to-date (-8%); 2) The article highlights potentially faster earnings growth in the other 493 S&P 500 companies; 3) It also mentions that expectations for Mag 7 earnings growth are slowing; 4) Rising bond yields are negatively affecting the Mag 7; and 5) BlackRock is advocating for investments in quality and growth at a reasonable price, which suggests some investors might be seeking bargains outside the Mag 7. The overall tone is that Apple might underperform relative to other stocks. There is a slight positive note as the IT sector (where Apple is) is projected for double digit profit growth. Given the negative sentiment towards the Mag 7, combined with some double digit growth, a moderate probability of the stock price to fall is assigned with a roughly equivalent probability for a rise.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.3, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.7, Reasoning: The article focuses on a shift away from the 'Magnificent Seven,' including Apple, towards a broader diversification within the S&P 500.  While Apple's recent performance is noted as down 8% year-to-date, the article doesn't directly offer bullish or bearish sentiment toward Apple specifically. The overall thesis is that the market may be over-concentrated in a few tech giants, and other sectors (like financials) offer better growth opportunities and more reasonable valuations. This indirectly suggests that Apple's growth might be comparatively slower than other sectors in the near future. The article highlights higher bond yields and potentially fewer Fed rate cuts, which generally negatively impacts tech stocks, to which Apple belongs. Thus, while the article doesn't explicitly recommend selling AAPL, it doesn't provide any positive news to drive an immediate price rise. The probability of a price rise is thus comparatively lower.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.3, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.7, Reasoning: The news article suggests a shift in investor focus away from the 'Magnificent Seven' (including Apple) towards other S&P 500 stocks, citing slower earnings growth expectations for the Mag 7 in 2025 (18% vs. 25% in 2024) and better opportunities in sectors like financials. Apple's stock is already down 8% year-to-date, and the article implies that the Mag 7 may underperform due to higher bond yields and inflated tech expectations. The emphasis on 'growth at a reasonable price' and defensive strategies further supports a potential decline in Apple's stock as investors reallocate funds.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.3, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.7, Reasoning: The news article discusses a shift in investor focus from the 'Magnificent Seven' (Mag 7) stocks, which include Apple Inc. (AAPL), to other S&P 500 stocks. The article suggests that the Mag 7 stocks, including AAPL, may experience a slowdown in earnings growth, with AAPL being down 8% year to date. The overall sentiment implies a more challenging environment for tech stocks like AAPL, potentially leading to a decrease in stock price. However, the article also mentions that investors are looking for 'quality and growth' and 'growth at a reasonable price,' which could mitigate the negative impact on AAPL's stock price.
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.35, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.65, Reasoning: The news article suggests that the 'Magnificent Seven' stocks, including Apple (AAPL), have been overcrowded and may experience a slowdown in earnings growth. In contrast, the other 493 S&P 500 stocks are expected to post solid earnings growth, making them more attractive investments. The article highlights the potential for double-digit profit growth in various sectors, including financials, information technology, and consumer discretionary. Given this information, the probability of Apple's stock price rising is lower than the probability of it falling, as investors may shift their focus away from the 'Mag 7' stocks and towards other opportunities.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.3, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.7, Reasoning: The financial news suggests a shift in investor sentiment towards the 'Magnificent Seven' stocks in the S&P 500 and recommends considering the remaining 493 stocks as they show potential for better earnings growth and better valuations. While Apple is part of the 'Magnificent Seven', it has shown recent declines which could potentially continue due to broader shifts away from these high-performing tech giants. The focus on quality and growth, along with defensive trading strategies, may further impact Apple negatively compared to other S&P 500 stocks.
Round: 1
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.25, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.75, Reasoning: The news suggests a shift in investor focus from the 'Magnificent Seven' stocks, which include Apple (AAPL), to potentially better performing stocks within the remaining S&P 493. The expectation of slowing earnings growth for the Mag 7, highlighted concerns about rising bond yields, and the focus on 'growth at a reasonable price' all imply a challenging environment for AAPL. Given that AAPL has already dropped 8% year-to-date and is part of a declining category of stocks, the probabilities lean towards a continued decline rather than a rise, supported by broader market sentiment and recent performance trends.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.3, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.7, Reasoning: The consensus from previous rounds strongly leans towards a negative outlook for Apple (AAPL) based on the provided news. The article suggests a shift in investor focus away from the 'Magnificent Seven' towards the other 493 S&P 500 stocks due to factors like: slowing earnings growth for the Mag 7, relatively better opportunities in sectors like financials, rising bond yields negatively impacting tech stocks, and an emphasis on value investing. Apple's stock is already down 8% YTD which reflects existing investor concerns. Given these factors, a falling stock price is more probable. The fact that almost all models predicted a higher probability of stock price fall in the previous round reinforces the conclusion that there is not any other positive information that suggests the price will go up.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.32, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.68, Reasoning: The news article focuses on a shift in investor preference away from the 'Magnificent Seven', including Apple, towards other S&P 500 companies offering potentially higher growth and more reasonable valuations.  While Apple's IT sector is projected for double-digit profit growth, the article highlights several factors that could negatively impact Apple's stock price: slowing earnings growth for the Mag 7, rising bond yields, and a generally cautious market sentiment due to macroeconomic factors.  The year-to-date decline of 8% in Apple's stock price further supports a bearish outlook. Although the article doesn't explicitly recommend selling AAPL, the overall narrative suggests that Apple may underperform compared to other sectors in the short term. Considering the consensus of previous models leaning towards a higher probability of a price fall, and the lack of strong bullish indicators in this news, I've assigned a slightly higher probability to a price fall. However, the possibility of a price rise still exists due to the IT sector's double-digit profit growth projection.

Apple's stock is already down 8% year-to-date, and the article suggests that higher bond yields and inflated tech expectations may further pressure the Mag 7. The emphasis on 'growth at a reasonable price' and defensive strategies implies a reallocation of funds away from high-valuation tech stocks like Apple. While the IT sector is projected for double-digit profit growth, the overall sentiment is cautious, favoring other sectors. Given these factors, the probability of Apple's stock price falling is higher than the probability of it rising.
